channel.title: math.AC updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.AC updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: The (universally) Japanese property for valuation rings and Pr\"ufer domains
item.description: arXiv:2502.12357v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We discuss the Japanese and universally Japanese properties for valuation rings and Pr\"ufer domains. These properties, regarding finiteness of integral closure, have been studied extensively for Noetherian rings, but very rarely, if ever, for non-Noetherian rings. Among other results, we show that for valuation rings and Pr\"ufer domains, the Japanese and universally Japanese properties are equivalent. This result can be seen as a counterpart of Nagata's classical result for Noetherian rings. This result also tells us many non-Noetherian rings, including all absolutely integrally closed valuation rings and Pr\"ufer domains, are universally Japanese.
item.dc:creator: Shiji Lyu

item.title: On conductor submonoids of factorial monoids
item.description: arXiv:2502.12712v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We give affirmative answers to Conjecture 4.16 in [1] and to Conjecture 2.3 in [3].
item.dc:creator: Alfred Geroldinger, Weihao Yan, Qinghai Zhong

item.title: A freeness criterion for complexes with derived actions
item.description: arXiv:2502.12868v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Inspired by the patching method of Calegari and Geraghty, and a conjecture of de Smit that has been proved by the first author, we present a conjectural freeness criterion without patching for complexes over commutative noetherian local rings with derived actions, and verify it in several cases.
item.dc:creator: Sylvain Brochard, Srikanth B. Iyengar, Chandrashekhar B. Khare

item.title: K3 surfaces of any Artin-Mazur height over $\mathbb{F}_5$ and $\mathbb{F}_7$ via Quasi-F-split singularities and GPU acceleration
item.description: arXiv:2502.12428v2 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We develop a fast algorithm to calculate the Artin-Mazur height (equivalently, the quasi-$F$-split height) of a Calabi-Yau hypersurface, building on the work in arXiv:2204.10076. We provide a implementation of our approach, and use it to show that there are quartic K3 surfaces of any Artin-Mazur height over $\mathbb{F}_{5}$ and $\mathbb{F}_7$.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Batubara, Jack J Garzella, Alex Pan

item.title: On the Rich Landscape of Complete Intersection Monomial Curves
item.description: arXiv:2411.19260v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: The aim of this survey is to explore complete intersection monomial curves from a contemporary perspective. The main goal is to help readers understand the intricate connections within the field and its potential applications. The properties of any monomial curve singularity will be first reviewed, highlighting the interaction between combinatorial and algebraic properties. Next, we will revisit the two main characterizations of complete intersection monomial curves. One is based on deep algebraic properties given by Herzog and Kunz in 1971, while the other is based on a combinatorial approach given by Delorme in 1976. Our aim is to bridge the gap between these perspectives present in the current literature. Then, we will focus on recent advances that show an intriguing connection between numerical semigroups and Alexander polynomials of knots. Finally, we will revisit the deformation theory of these curves and provide an answer to a question posed by Buchweitz and Greuel regarding curve deformations.
item.dc:creator: Patricio Almir\'on
